title: [Dynamic Regions] tikv crash for assertion failed: resp.has_availability_context() with tiflash
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
<!-- You can run `tikv-server --version` -->
TiKV
Release Version:   7.3.0-alpha
Edition:           Community
Git Commit Hash:   c27b43018ca83bd4103abf627c50293b841396bd
Git Commit Branch: heads/refs/tags/v7.3.0-alpha
UTC Build Time:    2023-07-17 11:11:24
Rust Version:      rustc 1.67.0-nightly (96ddd32c4 2022-11-14)
Enable Features:   pprof-fp jemalloc mem-profiling portable sse test-engine-kv-rocksdb test-engine-raft-raft-engine cloud-aws cloud-gcp cloud-azure
Profile:           dist_release
### What operating system and CPU are you using?
<!-- If you're using Linux, you can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->

### Steps to reproduce
<!-- If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error. A complete runnable program is good. -->
htap workload with tiflash
### What did you expect?
tikv crash
```

```
### What did happened?
normally

comments_data.body:
We should add a warn log and abort merge if the assert fails, otherwise multi-rocksdb cluster can not upgrade from older clusters.
https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/c16cab2c29ba36af51826e9b7d4e8bd950e0c15e/components/raftstore-v2/src/operation/command/admin/merge/prepare.rs#L371

What do you think? @tabokie @tonyxuqqi
@tonyxuqqi this still happens, maybe due to tiflash has not updated to the latest tikv version
